contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = greater earless lizard | image = Reptile tx usa.jpg | image_caption = '''''Cophosaurus texanus''''' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | subphylum = [[Vertebrata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | subordo = [[Iguania]] | familia = [[Phrynosomatidae]] | genus = '''''Cophosaurus''''' | species = '''''C. texanus''''' | binomial = ''Cophosaurus texanus'' | binomial_authority = [[Franz Hermann Troschel|Troschel]], 1852 | status = LC | status_system = iucn3.1 | status_ref = <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iucnredlist.org/apps/redlist/details/64062/0 |title=Cophosaurus texanus (Greater Earless Lizard) |publisher=Iucnredlist.org |date= |accessdate=2012-01-26}}</ref> }} The '''greater earless lizard''' ('''''Cophosaurus texanus''''') is a [[species]] of [[earless lizard]] [[Endemism|endemic]] to the southwestern [[United States]]. It is called "greater" because it grows larger than the earless lizards of the genus ''[[Holbrookia]]'', to which it is closely related. While ''C. texanus'' is the [[monotypic|only species]] within its [[genus]], it does have two [[subspecies]]. ==Geographic range== It is found in the [[United States]] in the states of [[Texas]], [[New Mexico]] and [[Arizona]]; and in [[Mexico]] in the states of [[Sonora]], [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]], [[Durango]], [[Coahuila]], [[Nuevo León]], [[Tamaulipas]], [[Zacatecas]], and [[San Luis Potosí]]. == Description == Greater earless lizards grow from 3-7 inches in length. They are characterized by the lack of external [[ear]] openings, which is presumably to prevent [[sand]] from entering their body while they dig. They are normally an overall [[tan (color)|tan]] or [[grey]] color, reflecting the color of the sand and rocks in their native [[habitat (ecology)|habitat]] for [[camouflage]], with [[black]], [[brown]] or [[white]] spotting. Males often develop bright [[blue]] and [[green]] colorations, while females tend to be duller in color, except when [[gravid]] when they turn a bright [[orange (colour)|orange]] color. Many have a distinctive pair of curved black bars just before the hind legs. [[Image:Cophosaurus_texanus.jpg|thumb|200px]] == Behavior == All earless lizards are [[Diurnal animal|diurnal]], basking [[lizard]]s. In the early morning they [[forage]] for [[insect]]s, and then spend several hours basking in the sun, until it becomes too hot, around 111°F (44°C) at the surface, when they retreat to a burrow or rock crevice. They are [[oviparous]]. == Subspecies == *Southwestern earless lizard, ''C. t. scitulus'' ([[Wilhelm Peters|Peters]], 1951) *Texas earless lizard, ''C. t. texanus'' [[Franz Hermann Troschel|Troschel]], 1850 == References == {{reflist}} *{{EMBL species|genus=Cophosaurus|species=texanus}} == External links == *[http://yahooligans.yahoo.com/content/animals/species/4577.html Yahooligans!
